intro: Achyranthes rubrofusca, commonly known as red-fusca knotweed, is a perennial herb native to tropical and subtropical regions. It typically grows to a height of 1 to 2 meters, featuring erect, branched stems that are often reddish in color. The plant has palmately lobed leaves with a rough texture and produces small, clustered flowers in late summer. Its fruit is a three-lobed capsule that releases tiny seeds when mature. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed habitats.
